entries.title: Impact Of AI On The Music Industry (Part 2 Of A Two Part Series)
entries.description: This article continues to explore the impact of AI on the music industry and looks at some of the pros and the cons, reinforcing the need for increased legal frameworks and copyright protections for musicians.

entries.title: Is Google Displacing Musicians With Its New Generative AI System: Music LM? (Part 1 Of A 2 Part Series)
entries.description: This article discusses the risks of Generative AI in the Music Industry and puts a spotlight on Google, MusicLM developments and encourages leaders in the music industry to think harder about the future of their industry.

entries.title: We Have A Waste Problem – Will ESG And Government Funding Help?
entries.description: If you feel really good about putting stuff in the recycling bin, you might be depressed to find out that only 5 % of what we recycle is actually recycled, according to the World Economic Forum.  The good news is, the ESG reporting push and new government funding can both help find new solutions.

entries.title: AMD Ryzen 7000 CPU Prices Cut Even Further
entries.description: More price drops for AMD ahead of 7000X3D launch

entries.title: How Salmon Feed Wildflowers And Transform Entire Landscapes
entries.description: This is the first study to demonstrate a connection between salmon and coastal plant growth and reproduction

entries.title: A Psychologist Offers Advice On How To Not Let Your Strong Opinions Isolate You
entries.description: Strong opinions can cause rifts in your close relationships. Here’s what you can do to be more tolerant of others’ viewpoints.

entries.title: Djokovic, Sabalenka Win 2023 Australian Open After Tournament Slammed By Extreme Heat
entries.description: Novak Djokovic won his 22nd Grand Slam title while Aryna Sabalenka won her first.

entries.title: The First 6GHz Processor Is Here: Does Intel’s Insane Core i9-13900KS Beat AMD?
entries.description: Intel is first to hit 6GHz but should you buy the world's fastest processor?

entries.title: Who Is Brave Enough To Make A Live-Action ‘Cyberpunk 2077’ Show?
entries.description: With the success of The Last of Us on HBO, mark my words, you are about to see an even bigger explosion of video game adaptation projects than we’ve already seen in recent years. So why not Cyberpunk 2077?

entries.title: ‘Lockwood And Co,’ With Perfect Review Scores, Is A Prime Netflix Cancellation Test
entries.description: I remember seeing a screensaver preview on Netflix for Lockwood and Co. a few days ago as my app idled, and my immediate thought was “well that’s probably going to get cancelled.”

entries.title: Free Stasis For All As ‘Destiny 2: Beyond Light’ Hits PS Plus For February
entries.description: Well, we may finally be starting to see the tangible fruits of the Sony Bungie acquisition.

entries.title: Apple’s Masive MacBook Pro Mistakes
entries.description: Apple's new MacBook Pro laptops are powerful and competent. But some of the decisions are not consumer-friendly.

entries.title: Apple Watch Ultra 2: New Leak Claims Dramatic Price Jolt
entries.description: A new report points to a display that will cost much more to make—and raise the price of the next Apple Watch Ultra.

entries.title: U.K. To Offer More Home Care As Emergency Care Crisis Persists
entries.description: Health officials in England have announced they will expand virtual wards and community response teams to keep more patients out of hospitals.

entries.title: What’s Behind The ESG Investment Backlash
entries.description: Sierra Club has called the war on ESG the latest form of climate denialism

entries.title: ‘Hi-Fi Rush’ Review Scores Behind Only ‘Elden Ring’ And ‘God Of War’ In The Last Year
entries.description: Xbox has scored a much-needed critical and audience hit with Hi-Fi Rush, a game that is attracting sky-high user scores even in an age of console partisan bombing, and its critic scores are starting to add up as...

entries.title: No Way Does ‘The Last Of Us’ Recast Bella Ramsey For Season 2
entries.description: In the wake of HBO renewing The Last of Us for season 2, I’ve heard some amount of chatter from fans who believe Bella Ramsey will be replaced as Ellie.

entries.title: Some Insist That Generative AI ChatGPT Is A Mirror Into The Soul Of Humanity, Vexing AI Ethics And AI Law
entries.description: Does generative AI ChatGPT represent a mirror into the soul of humanity? That's a tall order. We take a close look at this contention. Watch out for cracked mirrors.

entries.title: BMW: Cars Must Be Green Across The Entire Supply Chain
entries.description: BMW sees EVs as only one factor in making the automotive industry more sustainable. The environmental impact of the whole supply chain will need to be considered, and that's a hard thing to quantify.

entries.title: Apple AirTag: This Is Your Finest Moment Yet
entries.description: The Apple tracker has helped in a noble endeavor: the rescuing of a dog swept away by flood waters.

entries.title: Chogokin Gundam Aerial Toy Review: If Only All ‘Gundam’ Toys Were This Good
entries.description: What with the first season of 'Gundam: The Witch from Mercury' behind us, we now finally have a chogokin of the Gundam Aerial to play around with and Bandai Spirits have definitely nailed this one.

entries.title: Thanks To Climate Change, February Is Now The Cruelest Month
entries.description: Early winter has been warming across North America, but late winter is another story. Scientists have documented a cooling trend over more than 40 Februaries, marked by dangerous and increasingly common intrusions of Arctic air deep into the United States.

entries.title: Patients Flagged For Behavioral Issues Wait Longer, Get Less Care, New Study Shows
entries.description: Labeling patients as difficult can be harmful, especially when those labels not equitably applied. A new study shows which which patients are most likely to be flagged.

entries.title: Bills Damar Hamlin Offers Thanks In Video, Conspiracy Theorists Claim It’s CGI
entries.description: In the five-and-a-half minute video posted on Instagram, Hamlin thanked everyone who had saved his life, taken care of him, and sent him well wishes.

entries.title: Today’s Wordle #589 Hint, Clues And Answer For Sunday, January 29th
entries.description: Helpful Wordle hints and clues to help you solve today's puzzle, plus the answer and tips.

entries.title: Today’s ‘Heardle’ Answer And Clues For Sunday, January 29
entries.description: Here's today's 'Heardle' song, along with some hints.

entries.title: Today’s ‘Quordle’ Answers And Clues For Sunday, January 29
entries.description: Some hints and the solution for today's 'Quordle' are just ahead.

entries.title: First Ultraviolet Image Of Our Sun Reveals Weird Web-Like Structures
entries.description: Scientists have taken the first ultraviolet images of the Sun’s corona—its oddly hotter outer atmosphere—and found elongated, web-like plasma structures.
